"But we will go out there and do our best."

Coyle has earned enormous credit for the way he has handled himself throughout the trauma.

However, he revealed he had not slept on Sunday night as Muamba faced the most important part of his recovery.

He said: "Monday was a big day.

"The hospital had cooled him down to try help him and on Monday morning at 8am, they started to warm him back up again.

"That is when Fabrice had to kick in and do things of his own accord to have any chance.

"He did because we know the fighter he is and how strong he is.

"The way he came through that was incredible. Monday was an unbelievable day.

"We are all astonished with how far he has come.

"But we have to stress he is still in intensive care and he is still seriously ill. He has a long way to go.

"But what has happened is encouraging and we have to keep that in our thoughts"
articles.teaser: OWEN COYLE has revealed none of his players have asked to withdraw from his squad to face Blackburn on Saturday.
articles.headline: Coyle: All my squad want to play
articles.subdeck: STAYING STRONG ... Bolton Wanderers manager Owen Coyle

image.caption: UNDER PRESSURE ... Brad Friedel believes Spurs can regain their league position

article.caption: Harry wants bottle
Tottenham 1 Stoke 1

articles.articlebody:
BRAD FRIEDEL insists Tottenham are not in freefall and warned gloating Arsenal fans: You've not finished above us yet.

Spurs had a 10-point lead over their bitter rivals just four weeks ago but have since picked up just one point from four games.

While Spurs were held by Stoke last night, the Gunners beat Everton to move above them into third.

But Friedel is confident his side will regain their league position and is looking forward to a crunch clash with fifth-placed Chelsea on Saturday.

On the race for third, the veteran keeper said: "We'll see in nine games' time.

"You can't look forward five or six games in the Premier League and say 'oh that one's going to be tough and that one's going to be winnable'. It's impossible.

"The Premier League doesn't work like that.

"We're not concerned at all. We'll get prepared for Chelsea. We will go into that game very confident expecting to get a good result.

"It's definitely not all doom and gloom. It's definitely not a pressure situation where the lads are losing confidence.

"I've seen that happen many times and that's not what's happening right now."
articles.teaser: BRAD FRIEDEL insists Spurs are not in freefall and warned gloating Arsenal fans: You've not finished above us yet
articles.headline: Friedel: We're Gunner finish third
articles.subdeck: UNDER PRESSURE ... Brad Friedel believes Spurs can regain their league position

image.caption: HOT STUFF ... Jenson Button at a sweletering Sepang during last season's Malaysian Grand Prix
STEADY SHIP ... Michael Schumacher steers his Mercedes from the outside with the help of a crane
STONE ME ... Fernando Alonso abandons his Ferrari in the gravel at Albert Park
AUSSIE RULER ... Winner Jenson Button is flanked by Sebastian Vettel and Lewis Hamilton

video.caption: CHRIS HOCKLEY and Jim Munro preview the second race of the new F1 season

article.caption: Button expects Red Bull test
Fernandes finds reasons to be cheerful
Alonso aims to be a raining champ
Red-dy for battle

articles.articlebody:
JENSON BUTTON and McLaren were the big winners in Formula 1's opening Grand Prix of the season in Melbourne.

The British ace is the early leader in the drivers' championship having clinched the first race of the 2012 season in Australia, while team-mate Lewis Hamilton took third to sandwich world champion Sebastian Vettel on the podium.

As the action moves to a hot and steamy Sepang, our very own Chris Hockley and Jim Munro spring into life to give you their take on the weekend's F1 sowdown in our superb video preview.

You can follow the times for all Practice and Qualifying sessions LIVE on our F1 Race Centre, which will also provide live text commentary from the Malaysian Grand Prix.

And to make sure you are armed with all the 'did you know' facts that you need to carry you through the action at Sepang, we've prepared some killer stats below.

MALAYSIAN GRAND PRIX

Venue: Sepang International Circuit, Malaysia, a 5.543km circuit. The race will be held over 56 laps, a total distance of 310.408km. The race starts at 4pm local time on Sunday, March 25, which is 9am UK time.

On the Button: Jenson Button's win in Australia was the 13th of his career, bringing him level on the all-time list with fellow Brit David Coulthard and late Italian champion Alberto Ascari. Another win here would bring him level with Jack Brabham of Australia, Britain's Graham Hill and Emerson Fittipaldi of Brazil.

Lucky omen 1: The last time McLaren won the opening race of the season was 2008 with Lewis Hamilton, who went on to win the drivers' championship that season.

Lucky omen 2: Since 2002, the winner in Australia has ended the season as champion on seven occasions. The exceptions were David Coulthard in 2003, Giancarlo Fisichella in 2005 and Button in 2010. Maybe Jenson can put that right this season.

Poles apart: Lewis Hamilton's pole position in Melbourne was the 20th of his career. Vettel took 15 pole positions in 2011, the most anyone has achieved in a single season. Red Bull took 18 poles last year, a record for a team. Ferrari's last pole was with Alonso in Singapore in September 2010. Australia marked the first time since 2010 that a Red Bull driver had failed to qualify on the front row. It was also the first all-McLaren front row since the 2009 European Grand Prix in Valencia.

Red alert: Ferrari have won five of the 13 races held at Sepang. Michael Schumacher has started on pole five times at Sepang and won three of those races, all while driving for Ferrari.

No point: There are three F1 teams who are still waiting to celebrate their first ever chamionship point: Caterham (formerly Team Lotus), Marussia (formerly Virgin racing) and HRT (who didn't even get to compete in Oz).

Seventh heaven: Five of the last 10 races at Sepang have been won from pole. Nobody has ever won from further back on the grid than seventh, when Kimi Raikkonen won for McLaren in 2003.

Previous winners: Of all the drivers rolling up for this wekend's race, Fernando Alonso (2005, 2007), Jenson Button (2009), Kimi Raikkonen (2003, 2008), Michael Schumacher (2000, 2001, 2004) and Sebastian Vettel (2010, 2011) have all won in Malaysia.
articles.teaser: OUR complete video and stats package preview to this weekend's Grand Prix
articles.headline: SunSpeed 2012: Malaysian Grand Prix preview
articles.subdeck: HOT STUFF ... Jenson Button at a sweletering Sepang during last season's Malaysian Grand Prix

image.caption: FIGHT TO THE FINISH ... Arsene Wenger

video.caption: GUNNERS boss happy for his men to show other side to their game at Everton
EVERTON pleased with performance but rues linesman's offside error

article.caption: Everton 0 Arsenal 1

articles.articlebody:
ARSENE WENGER warned his team the tough part is yet to come after they turned their season around  and leapfrogged Spurs.

Arsenal were 12 points behind their rivals when they drew 0-0 at Bolton at the start of February.

But Thomas Vermaelen's header hoisted them into third, a point ahead of stuttering Tottenham.

Boss Wenger said: "What we have done in these past weeks has shown how quickly things can change in this league.

"The hardest part is still ahead of us, so we must keep our humility and fight for each other.

"But it's different to the start of the season when I had to answer questions like 'Are you praying you don't go down?'."

Everton boss David Moyes was seething over five shocking offside decisions by assistant referee John Riley, one of them to rule out a Royston Drenthe equaliser.

Moyes said: "The one for the goal was not even close. But I can't change it and I don't want to get myself in trouble, so I'd better leave it there."
articles.teaser: ARSENAL boss says tough part is yet to come after they turned their season around
articles.headline: Wenger warning
articles.subdeck: FIGHT TO THE FINISH ... Arsene Wenger

image.caption: CHEST THE JOB ... City need Sam to save 'em

article.caption: Tev the hero!
Can Mancini budget for the title?
Man City 2 Chelsea 1

articles.articlebody:
SO the gap is once more down to a solitary point.

And the all-Manchester shootout at the Etihad on Monday, April 30 is back on.

Yes, Manchester City just about scraped all three points last night thanks to Samir Nasri's winner five minutes from time.

But a side surprisingly low on confidence are going to have to make some serious improvement between now and that United showdown if they hope to still be in the shake-up.

Starting at Stoke on Saturday, a venue where they do not have the best of records.

But the greatest obstacle on the journey to that meeting with their neighbours is a trip to the Emirates on April 8.

If Arsenal are as fired up then as they are now, that could well be the day the title is won or lost.

What irony it would be if City were to be ultimately derailed by the club they have increasingly used for their most extravagant cherry-picking exercises.

Right now, there is a lot of talk about City needing to get Vincent Kompany and Joleon Lescott back in harness. But it goes far deeper than that.

Where has City's creativity gone? Where is their sharpness in front of goal that bought an astonishing 42 goals in the opening 14 league games?

For long spells last night we saw precious little of David Silva. And, long before the end, even Yaya Toure had run out of ideas.

This is why it was so important to get Carlos Tevez back in harness.

This is the one player opposition defences hate to play against. The player who always poses questions, always comes up with something a little different.

And so it was last night as, with time starting to run out, the Argentine dinked a reverse pass in for Nasri to run onto and shoot past Petr Cech.

But it was a desperately close-run thing.

Only when it was all over could the City fans relax.

It had been a fraught, tense affair with those of the light blue tendency in their customary default mode  fearing the worst.

Pessimists one and all, even those who in everything else may be born optimists.

At one point this season, City had been seven points clear and seemingly sailing towards their first title since 1968.

Not that City fans believed any of that guff. Last night was a night for shredded nerves  down on the pitch and up on the terraces. Sure, City created enough chances early on but they did not have the confidence to take them.

Nasri hit the bar, Mario Balotelli was in on Cech but failed to finish it off, Sergio Aguero passed instead of shooting  and so it went on.

And all this against a Chelsea defence without John Terry and minus the injured Branislav Ivanovic, head and shoulders their best player recently, who limped off after just 21 minutes.

It did not seem to be getting much better after the break.

In fact, it got demonstrably worse on the hour when Gary Cahill's shot took a slight deflection off Yaya Toure and wrong-footed Joe Hart.

It seemed big-night nerves had finally got the better of City  even on their own patch.

Now they were playing more like the team who had dropped 18 points away from home rather than the one with a 100 per cent record from 14 games at the Etihad.

Even the simplest of passes were going astray, along with a few players who had joined the missing list.

And then City got their big break  a volley from Pablo Zabaleta inside the box striking sub Michael Essien on the hand and Aguero equalising from the spot.

On came Tevez and, well, read all about it.

You are not quite sure how much more of this the City faithful can take.

Even with a team costing £450million, they are still to be convinced life has not got a sting in its tail.

But this is the way it has been down the years at City.

It is obviously something to do with living in United's shadow for so long.

Even when the Bell, Lee and Summerbee team were capturing the title in 1968, United were trumping it by winning the European Cup.

The only surprising thing last night was the way in which the home fans got so easily disgruntled with what they were watching  and making it so obvious.

This was, after all, a City side who were in the process of becoming the first Premier League side to win 20 consecutive matches at home.

This was, after all, a club who were just treading water before untold millions suddenly landed in their laps.

I suppose it all remains a little bit confusing for a set of supporters who are still half expecting their sheikh to up sticks and hightail back to the desert.

And so it goes on. The agony and the ecstasy.

steven.howard@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: STEVEN HOWARD says City need a serious improvement to trouble United next month
articles.headline: Nasri calms City's nerves
articles.subdeck: CHEST THE JOB ... City need Sam to save 'em

image.caption: RALLY CRY ... Harry Redknapp

video.caption: SPURS manager laments tough matches after his side are held by Stoke

article.caption: Tottenham 1 Stoke 1
Bolton ready to play again
Krasic: I should have joined Spurs
Spurs aces counselled

articles.articlebody:
HARRY REDKNAPP last night ordered his Tottenham wobblers to show more fight in the run-in.

Spurs slipped to fourth place, a point behind Arsenal, despite an injury-time leveller from Rafael van der Vaart.

Tottenham were 12 points ahead of the Gunners at the start of February but go to Chelsea on Saturday looking for a first win in five Premier League games.

Redknapp said: "We have to show some bottle, get above Arsenal again and stay in front of Chelsea.

"It's all to play for and we can still finish above Arsenal.

"There's a long way to go yet and Arsenal won't win every game, will they? I still want to finish third."

Cameron Jerome prodded Stoke ahead at White Hart Lane before Van der Vaart rescued a point.

Redknapp added: "Stoke were always going to be dangerous on the break and from set-pieces.

"I said to the lads before the game 'Don't foul'  and we conceded a free-kick and paid the penalty."

Potters boss Tony Pulis said:

"Cameron's done smashing. He took his goal brilliantly, it was a real goalscorer's goal."
articles.teaser: HARRY REDKNAPP last night ordered his Tottenham wobblers to show more fight in the run-in
articles.headline: Harry wants bottle
articles.subdeck: RALLY CRY ... Harry Redknapp

image.caption: GUNNING FOR PROMOTION ... Benik Afobe is heading to Reading

article.caption: Wenger warning
Everton 0 Arsenal 1
Wenger: We'll seal top four spot
We're Gunner turn up the heat

articles.articlebody:
ARSENAL youngster Benik Afobe has joined Reading on loan until the end of the season.

The highly-rated striker, 19, arrives at the Madejski Stadium with the Royals pushing for promotion from the Championship.

Reading boss Brian McDermott said: "We're delighted to have him, he wanted to come here and that was important because he had other options.

"We know him very well, we have watched him from a very young age.

"He's played a lot of games for England right up to the under-19s and then out on loan last season as well.

"He's a good addition to the squad and will help us with eight games to go."
articles.teaser: ARSENAL youngster Benik Afobe has joined Reading on loan until the end of the season
articles.headline: Afobe's Royal seal of approval
articles.subdeck: GUNNING FOR PROMOTION ... Benik Afobe is heading to Reading

image.caption: YOUNG AT HEART ... Tomas Rosicky

article.caption: Afobe's Royal seal of approval

articles.articlebody:
TOMAS ROSICKY reckons playing alongside Arsenal's young stars has given him a new lease of life.

The Czech star's best form in a Gunners shirt has coincided with the team winning their last six Premier League matches.

And the 31-year-old midfielder believes mentoring starlets like Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Theo Walcott has boosted his own performances.

Rosicky said: "This is still a group of very young players who need to have players they can grow next to.

"For me, it is fun to be with the young guys because they make me feel young as well!"

Rosicky and Arsenal's season has been turned around after the club suffered its worst-ever start to a Premier League campaign.

And the former Borussia Dortmund ace revealed he advised the squad's youngsters on how to bounce back from adversity.

Rosicky added: "Sometimes the heat of the moment can get to you  you want it so much, so badly, that it will affect your performance.

"It can make you tense and not relaxed like you had been. I was like that at a young age, I got caught up in the heat of the moment many times.

"When you go through your career and the difficult moments, you know how to cope with that.

"Sometimes success is closer than you think. When you have negative experiences during the season it can affect your future.

"It is difficult but you have to try not to be affected by negative stuff and fight through it."
articles.teaser: TOMAS ROSICKY says Arsenal young stars have given him a new lease of life
articles.headline: Rosicky feeling young at heart
articles.subdeck: YOUNG AT HEART ... Tomas Rosicky

image.caption: ON THE CASE ... Roberto Mancini

article.caption: Tev the hero!
Man City 2 Chelsea 1

articles.articlebody:
ROBERTO MANCINI and his Toure party were champions-elect for most of the season.

But are they good enough to finish in poll position?

Goalkeeper  YES

NO problems here. There is not a keeper in the league who City would swap Joe Hart for. Never looked back since displacing Shay Given in 2010 and is now firmly established as the No 1 for club and country.

Defence  NO

MANCINI has great options at full-back with Richards, Zabaleta, Kolarov and Clichy but they look a top centre-half short as Kompany and Lescott are their only two. Kolo Toure is good cover but Savic has struggled.

Midfield  YES

YAYA TOURE and Silva have been outstanding, even if both have run out of steam recently. Milner and Johnson have had to settle for bit-part roles such are the options at Mancini's disposal, but can he find right blend?

Strikers  YES

THEY all started the season on fire but since the start of March the goals have not been flowing. Balotelli and Dzeko are struggling and Aguero cannot do it on his own. Time to bring back Tevez. But he needs games.
articles.teaser: ROB'S Toure party had been tipped for the title. But can they still finish in poll position?
articles.headline: Can Mancini budget for the title?
articles.subdeck: ON THE CASE ... Roberto Mancini

image.caption: SPITTING MAD ... Real boss Jose Mourinho lost his rag

article.caption: Ron's the Real deal...but Messi is the world's best
Lionel Messi is highest-paid star in the world

articles.articlebody:
JOSE MOURINHO was sent off last night as Real Madrid slipped up in their charge towards the Spanish title.

The Special One was sent to the stands after sarcastically applauding ref Jose Romero following Villarreal's free-kick equaliser in the 1-1 draw at El Madrigal.

He could now face another touchline ban with his team's lead at the top now just six points.

Cristiano Ronaldo opened the scoring but Sergio Ramos and Mesut Ozil were also sent off after Mourinho got his marching orders.
articles.teaser: THE Special One was sent to the stands after sarcastically applauding ref Jose Romero
articles.headline: Jose red rage
articles.subdeck: SPITTING MAD ... Real boss Jose Mourinho lost his rag

image.caption: FIGHT ... FIFA president Sepp Blatter has vowed to crack down on criminals

articles.articlebody:
SEPP BLATTER has warned match-fixing is already a "scourge" on football.

The FIFA president reckons the problem is growing despite action from authorities across the globe.

FIFA have introduced an 'early warning system' which monitors suspicious betting patterns.

And they have also brought in the international police force Interpol to help investigate.

Turkish giants Fenerbahce were banned from the Champions League by UEFA this season due to match-fixing.

And Blatter said: "There is something that is new and also concerns the region where we are and that is illegal betting and this leads to match-rigging.

"I am very happy that together with UEFA and the other confederations and the early warning system we have been working for one year very closely with Interpol.

"We are working together against the scourge of match-rigging which is undermining our sport.

"FIFA, UEFA and all the other confederations are not responsible for all the evils besetting our world but we must see to it that we stay alert."

Blatter also announced FIFA will insure all players involved in international matches on official dates from September.

He said: "You have to have the best interests of the players.

"From this year we will have total insurance coverage for all matches on the international match calendar.

"This is an insurance coverage for the players, for the clubs and for the associations."
articles.teaser: SEPP BLATTER has warned match-fixing is already a "scourge" on football around the world
articles.headline: Blatter: We'll cut out match fixers
articles.subdeck: FIGHT ... FIFA president Sepp Blatter has vowed to crack down on criminals

image.caption: REHABILITATION ... Mohammad Amir

article.caption: Amir: I was tricked into spot-fixing

articles.articlebody:
MOHAMMAD AMIR has been told to forget about seeking a cut to his five-year ban from cricket  and turn his attentions solely to rehabilitation.

That is the verdict of International Cricket Council chief executive Haroon Lorgat, who was responding to the recent interview given by the disgraced Pakistan fast bowler.

Reaction to Amir's claim that he was tricked into spot-fixing at the Lord's Test versus England in 2010 has been mixed, with some believing his explanation of events to be unsatisfactory.

Others have mooted the possibility of an early return to cricket, given the 19-year-old's open admission and apology.

But ICC chief Lorgat has stressed the terms of his ban do not currently allow for a reduction in punishment and that learning from events that summer must be his first port of call.

He said: "I would prefer that the starting point should not be about whether we could reduce the sentence.

"Let that be the end result of a process of rehabilitation since he has now come clean, if that is indeed the case.

"Part of the sanction he received from the ICC tribunal was to educate himself and for him to educate others.

"So let us do all the necessary building blocks before we get to a point where anyone could ask, 'Does he now deserve a review?'"

Lorgat is also sad for the youngster that he issued a not-guilty plea at the ICC's disciplinary hearing in Doha last year  a stance Amir reversed for the criminal case and has since admitted he regrets.

When asked if he was disappointed Amir denied wrongdoing first time around, Lorgat replied: "I find it very unfortunate for Mohammad Amir.

"We did provide him with lots of opportunities. The tribunal might have looked at it differently and who knows what decision they could have come to on sanction?

"It could have been a different story. I am sad for him."

Lorgat also floated the idea of Amir's path back to acceptance, including ambassadorial work to warn other youngsters about the dangers of corruption in cricket.

He added: "If Mohammad Amir stands up and delivers a message of caution about this murky world, people are going to sit up and listen.

"That is one example of rehabilitation."
articles.teaser: ICC chief insists it is far too early to discussing cutting Pakistan star's ban
articles.headline: Amir must focus on rehabilitation
articles.subdeck: REHABILITATION ... Mohammad Amir

image.caption: BASKING IN THE SUN ... our man Plato shows off Sun logos on his exciting new MG

video.caption: SUNSPORT'S Jason Plato takes the covers off his BTCC 2012 challenger

articles.articlebody:
PUT your shades on, folks  here's me and my dazzling new toy.

Yep, we've finally taken the covers off my exciting  and very colourful, you'd have to say  KX Momentum Race Team MG6 GT Fastback.

After a race against time, we managed to get it to Silverstone for the Preview Day for this year's British Touring Car Championship.

Naturally, my SunSport pals Chris Hockley and Mark Clews were there to witness the big moment.

And before I knew it they had shoved a microphone under my nose and pointed a camera at my face.

So for the column this time, why don't we let their video tell the story?

That way, as well as me rabbiting on, you get to see the MG on the move for the first time.

The first BTCC round at Brands Hatch is just around the corner now, on April 1.

There's no doubt I will start as an underdog because we will have had precious little testing before the actual racing.

But click on the video and watch my lips: Write us off at your peril!
articles.teaser: JASON PLATO takes the covers off KX Momentum Race Team MG6 GT Fastback in our splendid video special
articles.headline: Write me off at your peril
articles.subdeck: BASKING IN THE SUN ... our man Plato shows off Sun logos on his exciting new MG

image.caption: INCREDIBLE HULK ... Force India's Nico Hulkenberg gives us his inside line on the Malaysian Grand Prix

article.caption: SunSpeed 2012: Malaysian Grand Prix preview
F1 stars pay tribute to tragic Simoncelli
Horner not Fer moving

articles.articlebody:
SURPRISINGLY for somebody who looks like a stranger to glorious sunshine, Nico Hulkenberg LIKES the stifling humidity of tropical Malaysia.

And the rising star is itching to turn up the heat on his rivals at the Sepang track this weekend after suffering the disappointment of a first lap crash in Australia.

Hulkenberg, who qualified in the top ten at Melbourne, reckons the key in Malaysia will be finding the right balance in his car between the downforce needed for Sepang's sweeping corners and the ultimate speed required for its two long straights.

But why don't we let him tell you all about it in person?

With a little help from our friends at Force India, here is The Hulk's guide to the Malaysian Grand Prix. Just click on the video.
articles.teaser: FORCE INDIA star itching to turn up the heat on his rivals at Sepang
articles.headline: The Hulk's incredible guide to the Malaysian Grand Prix
articles.subdeck: INCREDIBLE HULK ... Force India's Nico Hulkenberg gives us his inside line on the Malaysian Grand Prix

image.caption: TRAGIC ... Marco Simoncelli

articles.articlebody:
FERNANDO ALONSO and Felipe Massa today paid their respects to a hero of Italian motorsport at the Sepang International Circuit.

Marco Simoncelli was killed at the track in the Malaysian round of the MotoGP championship on October 23 last year at the age of just 24.

Simoncelli  who won the 250cc world championship in 2008  was revered in his homeland, with 20,000 people attending his funeral in his home town of Coriano, near Rimini.

By way of a tribute, Alonso, Massa and several members of the team visited the turn 11 site of Simoncelli's accident ahead of this weekend's Malaysian Grand Prix.

In posing for a picture, the seven-strong group held up a pit board that read 'Sic (short for Simoncelli) sempre con noi', which means 'Forever with us', and included Ferrari's Prancing Horse emblem, an Italian flag, and his racing number, 58.

Alonso, clearly choked as he spoke, said: "After the accident of Marco here last year, racing here will now always be sad.

"It will be tough and difficult knowing one of our colleagues died here.

"But we did one picture this afternoon, Felipe and me and some members of the team, in turn 11 where the accident happened.

"That was in memory of him. All the Ferrari family and the Italian people will always remember him, and that's the most important thing."
articles.teaser: FERNANDO ALONSO and Felipe Massa have paid their respects to Marco Simoncelli
articles.headline: F1 stars pay tribute to tragic Simoncelli
articles.subdeck: TRAGIC ... Marco Simoncelli

image.caption: Confession ... Tulisa talks in online clip last night

article.caption: Tulisa is dragged into sex vid storm
X Factor Tulisa is so Skin love
Tulisa and Dappy Twitter war over N-Dubz split
Tulisa Contostavlos beds TOWIE hunk Mark Wright
Tulisa shows who's boss

articles.articlebody:
X FACTOR judge Tulisa Contostavlos last night apologised to fans as she admitted it was her in a sex tape touted online.

The N-Dubz singer, 23, claimed the tape showed an "intimate moment" with ex Justin Edwards.

And she said that the DJ  called MC Ultra  had "betrayed" her by posting the X-rated video online.

She said: "I am devastated, heartbroken.

"When you share an intimate moment with someone that you love and trust you never imagine for one minute that footage may at any point be shared with the rest of the UK."

The film, from a high-quality camera phone, shows Tulisa performing a sex act for over six minutes.

An internet firm charged viewers £3.90 to download it on Monday but the site was suspended several hours later.

Tulisa posted a video apology on YouTube called The Truth About The Tape, linked from her Twitter account. In it she twice held up photos of her and Justin  who she went out with for several years from the age of 17.

One showed them on holiday together on the island of Kos in Greece.

She claimed: "This is the person, Justin Edwards aka Ultra, who is my ex-boyfriend, that has put it online, who is the other person on the tape."

Justin used his Twitter account @officialultra to deny her claims. He tweeted: "It's nothing to do with me. #backtowork."

He was unavailable for comment last night.

m.wilkinson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: X FACTOR judge Tulisa Contostavlos has apologised to fans  after admitting it was her in a sex tape touted online
articles.headline: Tulisa: It IS me in that sex film
articles.subdeck: Confession ... Tulisa talks in online clip last night

image.caption: Beyond the grave ... Gwyneth Paltrow says she talks to late father's spirit through wedding ring

article.caption: Paltrow flashes cop a big fat Gwyn
Regretting those carbs Kate?
Gwyneth pal row
Gwyneth Paltrow is buzzing with joy
Gwyneth shows off her pin-credible figure in new Geek Chic fashion range
Beyonce will Gywn and bear holiday grub

articles.articlebody:
GWYNETH Paltrow says she chats to her late dad's wedding ring  as it contains his spirit.

The star claims she has been in regular contact with Bruce Paltrow since his death from throat cancer.

Gwyneth, 39, added in an emotional interview: "I always hold on to his wedding ring. I ask it questions, I feel like it keeps me safe. I really sense the energy of his soul, I don't think that evaporates.

"I feel my dad, I still feel his love, I still speak to him and I still love him."

TV and film director Bruce died in Rome in 2002 while celebrating his daughter's 30th birthday.

Gwyneth, who won the best actress Oscar for Shakespeare In Love in 1998, blames his death at 58 on smoking.

But she says it had a positive effect by turning her into a fitness freak.

She added: "Half the reason my life is good and has real, true value is that he died. I'd obviously rather have him alive, but he gave me so much in his death."

Gwyneth now has a strict exercise and yoga regime, avoids carbs and sticks to a diet of grains, fruit and veg that matches her blood type.

When Bruce became ill she tried to get him on healthy food like gluten-free noodles  but he said it tasted like newspaper.

Her Coldplay star hubby Chris Martin dedicated a song to Bruce on his X&Y album in 2005.

In 2006 Gwyneth claimed the couple's London home was haunted by 19th-century classical musician Adolphus White, who died there.

a.tinney@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: HOLLYWOOD star Paltrow claims she's been in regular contact since his cancer death
articles.headline: Gwyn: I chat to dead dad via ring
articles.subdeck: Beyond the grave ... Gwyneth Paltrow says she talks to late father's spirit through wedding ring

image.caption: Kelly Brook whipping them out ... for Sport Relief

article.caption: Tinchy Stryder gets toga-ther with Kelly Brook
Kelly Brook flows
Check out Kelly is bloomin' lovely

articles.articlebody:
THERE's no danger of Kelly Brook keeping her socks on in the bedroom  she uses them to bulk up her balcony.

She whipped a pair out of her bra for this snap and said: "I can't believe my secret's out there  socks are an essential item in my styling kit."

But the pin-up wasn't really baring her sole  it was just a gag to promote Sport Relief's £2.50 charity socks from Sainsbury's.
articles.teaser: KELLY Brook doesn't keep her socks on in the bedroom  they bulk up her balcony
articles.headline: My what big feet you have Kelly...
articles.subdeck: Kelly Brook whipping them out ... for Sport Relief

image.caption: Making history ... One Direction celebrating US number one in New York

video.caption: UP ALL NIGHT is first debut album by a British group to hit top spot in America

article.caption: Kim is Harry's Style
One Direction to beat Beatles
One Direction to live the dream

articles.articlebody:
EVEN on the day One Direction make history by landing a US Billboard No1 with their debut album, Harry Styles still can't stop thinking about the bedroom.

The lads have achieved with their first album what no other British band has ever done in the States  not even The Beatles.

But the first thing on Harry's mind, with all the money about to pour in, is getting himself a decent mattress.

Harry revealed: "I'm going to treat myself to a new one. I need a good one. The one I'm using is still the one that was there when I moved in. The springs have gone."

I bet they have. The bed has probably seen more action in a month than most do in a year.

Harry continued: "I hear those memory foam ones are good. I need one of those."

The lads went into shock when they found out yesterday they had shifted 176,000 copies of their first album, Up All Night, to bag the No1 spot in the States and break a world record.

And it didn't take long for Harry, Zayn, Niall, Louis and Liam to start making plans about how to celebrate.

Harry  who also gave his verdict on other rock legends, pictured  said: "We'll have a party when we get a chance but first of all we're definitely going to get Simon Cowell to cough up and take us out for dinner in LA."

Aside from chatting about how to celebrate, Harry took a moment to get his head around the group's huge success.

He said: "We're just five normal lads from the UK. What has happened to us is incredible.

"I know it sounds like a massive cliché but it's truly amazing  it's what dreams are made of.

"Just over a year ago we were five boys who didn't know each other. Now we're five best friends and having amazing things happen to us.

"We really are truly grateful to every one of our fans, to anyone who has ever supported us in any way. We just want to thank everyone, everyone is amazing."

Pretty sure their bank manager feels the same way.
articles.teaser: ONE Direction are quids in after making history in the US with debut hitting number one
articles.headline: Harry to splash out on mattress
articles.subdeck: Making history ... One Direction celebrating US number one in New York

image.caption: She's in fashion ... Vic in Vogue

article.caption: Posh and birthday girl Eva's battle of the Little Black Dresses
Victoria Bib-ham loves a bit of Harp couture
Victoria and Brooklyn horse ride in Hollywood
Even Victoria can't resist ogling hubby David in his pants

articles.articlebody:
VICTORIA Beckham looks Posher than ever as she poses for Vogue.

The singer-turned-fashion designer gets her pout down to perfection in the pic to accompany her latest interview with the magazine.

And alongside the classy snap she opens up about Brand Beckham and reveals just how she got skinny again after having her fourth child.

The 37-year-old says losing the baby weight after Harper's birth didn't come as easily as we all may have thought.

She tells the mag: "I ran a lot. I did it six days a week. I become quite obsessive when I get into something."

And with looking lean on the brain, when it came to fashion designing Victoria says she wanted to create pieces to hide women's wobbly bits.

She reveals: "I've never been a 6ft tall, skinny model (she's 5ft 4in), so therefore I wanted to create an illusion.

"People always think I'm taller than I am  not just because of the shoes I wear but because of the way I dress. It's all relatively streamlined."

Her 'sucky-sucky' dress is a perfect example. The mum-of-four says: "It gives [my customers] a little waist. It's great on the boobs, it's great on the bottom."

She also tells how now she's got her feet firmly planted in the world of fashion she won't be pulling out her platforms for another attempt at the pop charts anytime soon.

She says of her former Spice Girl bandmates: "I'm so appreciative of my past. I respect all the girls and really enjoyed what I did then, but this is what I love to do.

"I was never going to be the best singer or dancer. I worked very hard, but it took a long time for me to find something to say, 'Oh, I'm not bad at this'. And I've found that with what I'm doing now."

And she says her British Fashion Council's Designer Brand award win meant more to her than any of her music accolades.

Victoria Beckham's full interview is in the April 2012 issue of Vogue US

www.vogue.com/magazine/article/victoria-beckham-the-victoria-line/#1
articles.teaser: VICTORIA Beckham poses and pouts for Vogue magazine
articles.headline: Pout and Becks
articles.subdeck: She's in fashion ... Vic in Vogue

image.caption: 'Reunion' ... Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown

article.caption: Bobbi: I still talk to mum
Whitney girl love for 'bruv'
Whitney Houston family in drug fear
Whitney Houston's daughter to inherit her entire estate
Hou loves ya, Jermaine Jackson

articles.articlebody:
WHITNEY Houston planned to REMARRY ex-hubby Bobby Brown, claims a pal.

Derrick Handspike, who wrote a book about Bobby, says the pair reunited weeks before her death.

He said: "They were planning a small wedding with just their daughter Krissi."

Brown  wed to Whitney for 14 years  was blamed for her descent into drugs.

Singer Whitney, 48, who was found dead last month at a Los Angeles hotel, is said to have already split with her rapper lover Ray J.
articles.teaser: WHITNEY Houston planned to REMARRY her ex-hubby Bobby Brown in ceremony, claims pal
articles.headline: Whitney's intent 'to wed Bobby'
articles.subdeck: 'Reunion' ... Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown

image.caption: Baby joy ... Reese Witherspoon

article.caption: Reese Witherspoon's looking for a needle in a haystack
War and Reece
Reese Witherspoon looks pretty hot in pink

articles.articlebody:
ACTRESS Reese Witherspoon is pregnant with her third child.

The Walk the Line star, 35, is said to have been expecting for around three months.

A source said: "The timing is right. Reese is so happy."

Another source said Reese is "right around 12 weeks" and that she is "not planning to announce it".

It will be her first child with husband Jim Toth, a talent agent.

She has two children from her previous marriage to actor Ryan Phillippe, 37  daughter Ava, 12, and son Deacon, eight.
articles.teaser: HOLLYWOOD actress Reese Witherspoon is pregnant with first child with agent husband
articles.headline: Witherspoon's third kid is on the way
articles.subdeck: Baby joy ... Reese Witherspoon

image.caption: Kat fight ... Hollywood A-lister Gwyneth Paltrow

article.caption: Kate gives us an eyeful
Kate Moss is Absolutely Fabulous in new role
Kate is shawl-y the best
Stew's that girl?
Beyonce will Gywn and bear holiday grub
A Girl Like Me (plus one)

articles.articlebody:
KATE MOSS lives her life like she's still at school  ruling her gang of mates with a fag in her hand.

But every now and then someone steps up and challenges her super-cool authority, like good old Gwyneth Paltrow.

The Hollywood actress put Kate in her place in spectacular fashion at Sir Philip Green's 60th birthday party in Mexico during a bit of verbal sparring on the beach.

And the put-down was straight out of a comedian's top drawer. A source said: "Gwyneth had gone for a jog on the beach before the big birthday bash. Kate was out for a walk, eating crisps, when Gwyneth ran past.

"Kate said, 'Oi, what you out jogging for?' Gwyneth fired back, 'So I don't look like you when I get old'. Kate was speechless for a second then spat back and threw some crisps at her. She said, 'Why don't you eat some f****** carbs!'

"The spat was the talk of the dinner. Everyone was having a giggle about it.

"Kate is seen as queen of the cool crowd but not everyone falls into line."

I always thought Gwyneth was a bit timid  but she has earned my respect for that one. It's a classic.

Topshop boss Philip put together his usual A-list line-up for the bash. He had Kate Hudson and Matt Bellamy, Gwyneth and Chris Martin, Kate and Jamie Hince, plus Robbie Williams, Stevie Wonder  and loads more.

Piers Morgan has been moaning about how the model kicked him in the shins when they met at a dinner. In future he should take Gwyneth as security.

She now has the honour of owning very rare Kate Moss kryptonite. If she could bottle it, Philip Green could make a fortune selling it.
articles.teaser: HOLLYWOOD actress's model put-down is talk of Sir Philip Green's 60th birthday party
articles.headline: Gwyneth pal row
articles.subdeck: Kat fight ... Hollywood A-lister Gwyneth Paltrow

image.caption: Bum note ... David Walliams on the Jonathan Ross Show

article.caption: BGT first look shows no signs of boybands
One's Duch a fan of Britain's Got Talent
David Walliams gives Simon Cowell the willies
Simon Cowell style shocker
Simon Cowell: 'BGT is so cool'

articles.articlebody:
DAVID Walliams has revealed he is constantly asked one question  whether Simon Cowell is gay.

The new Britain's Got Talent judge said family, celeb mates and fans forever quiz him over his new boss's sexuality.

In an appearance with Simon on this weekend's Jonathan Ross Show, the comic said he finds it intriguing that most people seem obsessed by The X Factor supremo's preferences.

He said: "I have never done anything where people are more interested. The main question I get is, 'Is Simon gay?'

"Even my mum was going, 'Yeah he is really nice  is he gay?'"

Teasing Simon, David added: "Well we know the answer to that. With the gay thing, the jury is still out."

In the scenes to be aired on Saturday, the Little Britain funnyman cavorted on the sofa. He even wound up media mogul by touching his leg with his hand.

He also tweeted a picture of himself with Simon as they sat in the green room, with the caption: "Me and my boyfriend".

David told how Simon often blamed HIM for auditions starting late  claiming that he was "busy" gobbling gourmet food.

He said: "We don't tend to start auditions until 4pm. Simon is a bit late and then he goes in front of the audience and says, 'The reason we are starting late today is because David is eating a three-course meal.'

"The audience are booing me because that's his idea of a joke."

Meanwhile, Simon dashed fans' hopes that he will return to The X Factor by insisting he only came back to BGT after a fans' petition.

Due to his commitments to the US version, he said it would be too difficult to join the panel.

He said: "It's impossible. I would like to but at the moment they run at exactly the same time. But I do miss not doing it."

When host Jonathan said his absence was noticed in last year's BGT, Simon quipped: "There was a petition and six million people signed it to get me back."

The pop guru also confessed to proposing to scores of girls. After admitting they had ALL refused, Simon assured the audience he was happy to be single.

  • Hollywood's Danny DeVito, comic Dara O'Briain and singer Labrinth also make an appearance on the ITV1 show on Saturday at 10.20pm.
articles.teaser: EXCLUSIVE: BRITAIN'S Got Talent judge says he is always asked if boss Simon is gay
articles.headline: David Walliams: Fans always ask me if Simon likes men or laydees
articles.subdeck: Bum note ... David Walliams on the Jonathan Ross Show

image.caption: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

article.caption: Jenna-Louise Coleman is the new pal for Dr Who
Karen Gillan's the Dr Ooh girl
Who's snogging Karen Gillan?
Dr Who and pals get exterminated
Matt Smith is Time Lord of the Fries

articles.articlebody:
NEW Doctor Who sidekick Jenna-Louise Coleman has revealed that she has been a nervous wreck trying to keep her new job under wraps.

The former Emmerdale actress was forbidden from talking about sci-fi's biggest secret until her role was officially announced yesterday.

She admitted: "I am so relieved it is out. My flatmates had no idea and it has kind of opened this whole web of lies.

"I have realised that I am actually quite a good liar, which is terrifying actually. I'm beyond excited  I want to get started already."

Speculation about who would take over as the Time Lord's assistant has been rife since Karen Gillan  who has played Amy Pond for the past two series  announced her departure in December.

She will leave in the fifth episode of the series, which is due to screen on BBC1 in the autumn.

But fans will have to wait until the show's Christmas special for the introduction of the new character.

The 25 year old  who played Emmerdale lesbian Jasmine Thomas until 2009  won the role after wowing bosses with her screen test and her chemistry with Time Lord Matt Smith.

But show boss Steven Moffat has so far refused to reveal the name of the character that she will play. He said: "Who she's playing, how the Doctor meets her and even where he finds her are all part of one of the biggest mysteries the Time Lord has ever encountered. Even by the Doctor's standards, this isn't your usual boy meet girl."

Of Amy Pond's exit, he said: "It will be a final encounter with the angels and not everybody gets out alive  and I really mean it this time."

Jenna-Louise  a long-time fan of the show  admitted that former Time Lord David Tennant and his sidekick Billie Piper were her favourite pairing.

But she described her new co-star Matt Smith as "amazing" and "very supportive".

And Moffat said Jenna-Louise  who also stars in ITV1's Titanic series which starts on Sunday  was the only person he has met who can keep up with Matt's pace.

He also revealed: "There was a moment I remember when they were auditioning together and they both looked frightened doing a Doctor Who scene.

"It was an instant poster and I thought, 'God that's brilliant'."

Jenna-Louise found out that she had landed the job while in a Marks & Spencer store buying food.

She said: "I was debating what goes best in a salmon salad and I got a call from my agent.

"I thought, 'I can't carry on shopping now.' So I put down my basket and left.

"I couldn't tell anyone so I went for a bit of a walk and tried to digest it. It's all been quite surreal."

Moffat also confirmed that as well as this year's six episodes, a further eight will be broadcast next year to mark the show's 50th anniversary.

The first episode aired in November 1963 with William Hartnell in the title role.



Who gets two kids



DAVID Tennant claims he is a "double dad", after adopting his wife's ten-year-old son.

The former Doctor Who actor said he made the decision to adopt his actress wife Georgia Moffett's son Tyler last year, shortly after the birth of the couple's daughter, Olive.

He said: "My baby is almost a year old and I adopted my wife's boy last year as well, so I became a father twice in six months. That's got to be something of a record, hasn't it?"

David met Georgia when she guest-starred in an episode of Doctor Who in 2008, playing his daughter.

And after falling in love, the pair married on New Year's Eve in 2011.

Their daughter Olive was born in March last year and it was shortly afterwards that David officially adopted Tyler and they all became one big happy family.

Georgia  the daughter of former Time Lord Peter Davison and American actress Sandra Dickinson  gave birth to Tyler in 2002, aged just 17.

She brought him up alone and has never publicly revealed the identity of her son's father.
articles.teaser: EMMERDALE'S Jenna-Louise Coleman says that she was a nervous wreck trying to keep her new job under wraps
articles.headline: Jenna-Louise's sci-fi of relief
articles.subdeck: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

image.caption: Frank's Blues ... Lampard with Karen Brockman (Ramona Marquez)

article.caption: Christine Bleakley's bummed out

articles.articlebody:
OUTNUMBERED'S Brockman family are back causing chaos  this time with Dancing On Ice host Christine Bleakley and fiancé Frank Lampard.

The kids, including Karen (Ramona Marquez), test the Chelsea ace's patience in a hilarious sketch for Sport Relief.

Frank said: "I'm hoping people enjoy it. If not they can laugh at my acting skills!"

Christine added: "I was giggling the whole way through."

It will be seen during Sport Relief from 7pm tomorrow on BBC1.
articles.teaser: CHELSEA star faces toughest challenge yet  Brockman kids Karen, Ben and Jake
articles.headline: Frank Lampard is a real Sport
articles.subdeck: Frank's Blues ... Lampard with Karen Brockman (Ramona Marquez)

image.caption: The long and short of it ... Emma Watson with new barnet on set of The Bling Ring

article.caption: Emma Watson is Bling Ring burglar
Harry Potter star has £31m in the coffers
Emma Watson's a real shape-shifter
Emma Watson wows at premiere

articles.articlebody:
EMMA Watson has had a magical transformation  after her locks went from short to long overnight.

The Harry Potter star did not wave a wand to achieve her new look  the brunette hair extensions are for her latest film role.

Emma, 21, cut her hair short after wrapping the final movie in the boy wizard series in a bid to distance herself from Hermione Granger, the character she had played for ten years.

But she got her long tresses back as she started working on The Bling Ring on set in LA, California.

Despite the glorious sunshine, the British beauty was wrapped up in a padded coat, pink tracksuit bottoms and Ugg boots as she began filming the Sofia Coppola movie at the beginning of the week.

It is based on a real gang of celebrity-obsessed teenagers who burgled the homes of their idols  including Lindsay Lohan, Megan Fox and Orlando Bloom.

The gang, who were also known as the Hollywood Hills Burglar Bunch, bagged nearly £2million in cash and jewellery before being arrested in 2009 and subsequently jailed.
articles.teaser: HARRY Potter star gets long hair extensions as she begins filming new movie The Bling Ring
articles.headline: Emma Watson's magic new look
articles.subdeck: The long and short of it ... Emma Watson with new barnet on set of The Bling Ring

image.caption: Humble ... fired Apprentice candidate Bilyana Apostolova

article.caption: Tough London lesson for struggling Apprentices
Our benefits culture is a joke..parents should send their kids out to work at 13  says Lord Sugar
Apprentice wannabe gets a lot of Hype
The Apprentice unveiled

articles.articlebody:
LORD Sugar has been blasted for "humiliating" fired wannabe Bilyana Apostolova.

In the opener of BBC1's new series of The Apprentice last night, viewers heard of Bilyana's humble upbringing in Bulgaria before coming to the UK aged 17 to forge a successful career in the City as a risk analyst.

But she was hauled into the boardroom for a poor showing in her task. When she tried to defend herself by outlining her achievements, she was slapped down by Lord Sugar.

He branded her tale a "sob story". Bilyana said later: "He humiliated me with his response.

"He said, 'Let's not get the violin out.' I thought that was quite ironic.

"Always, he says, 'I'm an East End boy from the back of the truck to one of the top guys... I was trying to bond with him.

"I shouldn't have gone. I've seen him credit people for sticking up for themselves which was the effect I was after  not the opposite and getting fired.

"You're under the spotlight and you don't get time to pick your words carefully and things come out as a bit of a rant."



Review



HD isn't the best look for big Al but series eight of The Apprentice kicked off in fine style.

The "buy stuff, print pictures on it, sell it" task led to decent bickering between the sorry 16 but the "best" lines were Sugar's: "I'm looking for the Marks to my Spencer, the Lennon to my McCartney".

Someone tell the scriptwriter: "You're fired."
articles.teaser: LORD Sugar has been blasted for mocking Bilyana Apostolova over upbringing while he fired her from show
articles.headline: Apprentice reject: Lord Sugar's jibe was so poor
articles.subdeck: Humble ... fired Apprentice candidate Bilyana Apostolova

image.caption: Suits you ... Mark Wright hits the town with Ryan Thomas

article.caption: Roch 'n' roll birthday
Tulisa's met her match in Jack O'Connell
Mark Wright suns himself on luxury yacht

articles.articlebody:
MARK Wright lands exactly the wrong accessory for his slick dark suit  a handbag in pink.

Corrie actor Ryan Thomas gave him the bag as they left Rochelle Wiseman's birthday bash at Aura in London's Mayfair on Tuesday night. The Saturdays star turned 23.

The bag belonged to Ryan's cobbles co-star Brooke Vincent  who soon got it back.
articles.teaser: I'M A Celeb star accessorised his slick dark suit with a clutch as he headed out on the town
articles.headline: Handbags at dawn for Mark Wright
articles.subdeck: Suits you ... Mark Wright hits the town with Ryan Thomas

image.caption: Unlikely duo ... singer Jack White and Lambeth Councillor Christiana Valcarcel in a Q & A session

articles.articlebody:
JACK White might be without his "sister", drummer and ex-wife Meg, these days but he formed another duo this week  with the mayor of Lambeth, councillor Christiana Valcarcel.

She chaired a Q&A with Jack after the first playback of his solo album Blunderbuss at County Hall on London's South Bank on Tuesday.

And Christiana gave the eccentric singer a run for his money.

The "first citizen of Lambeth" had been given a script but decided to ditch it and go off-piste instead.

She told him about her favourite track on the album and grilled him about an upholstery business he ran when he was younger.

But Jack seemed pleased with the curve balls.

His Blunderbuss playback was a success too.

Tracks such as On And On And On, I'm Shakin', Hip (Eponymous) Poor Boy, Sixteen Saltines and album closer Take Me With You When You Go stand up next to his work with The Whirte Stripes, The Dead Weather and The Raconteurs.

There will be at least one mayor buying it when it's released on April 23.
articles.teaser: JACK WHITE might be without his "sister", drummer and ex-wife MEG, these days but he formed another duo this week  with the mayor of Lambeth, councillor Christiana Valcarcel
articles.headline: Jack White doing the Lambeth talk
articles.subdeck: Unlikely duo ... singer Jack White and Lambeth Councillor Christiana Valcarcel in a Q & A session

image.caption: Record breakers ... One Direction
No1 Direcction - Lads become first Brit band to debut at top of US album charts

article.caption: Kim is Harry's Style
One Direction to beat Beatles
One Direction to live the dream

articles.articlebody:
ONE Direction have made history by becoming the first British band to top the US album chart with their debut record.

A sizeable 176,000 copies of Up All Night were sold across the pond in its first week, sending the collection to No1.

The album went one better than its performance in the UK chart, where it peaked at No2 in December.

One Direction  formed on the X Factor in 2010 after failing to impress as solo singers  have hailed their achievement as a "dream come true".

Singer Harry Styles said: "We simply cannot believe that we are No1 in America.

"We want to thank each and every one of our fans in the US who bought our album and we would also like to thank the American public for being so supportive of us."

Niall Horan added: "When we got put together as a group, we couldn't imagine ourselves coming to America, let alone releasing our album here, so for us to be sitting at the top of the US album charts is unbelievable."

One Direction have gone down a storm in the States, with swarms of female fans greeting Harry, Niall, Zayn Malik, Liam Payne and Louis Tomlinson in LA on their first trip to the US.

Since then they've toured with American boyband Big Time Rush, and last week landed their own TV show with kids channel Nickelodeon.

Commenting on their chart-topping album, boss Simon Cowell said: "I couldn't be happier for One Direction, it is an incredible achievement.

"They deserve it. They have the best fans in the world."
articles.teaser: LADS become first UK band to top the US album chart with their debut release
articles.headline: No1 Direction make album history in the States
articles.subdeck: Record breakers ... One Direction

image.caption: Disaster movie ... John Carter is set to lose a fortune for Disney

article.caption: Carter the unstoppable pecs machine
Plait's a great look, Helen

articles.articlebody:
DISNEY sci-fi epic John Carter is set to lose £126million this financial quarter  making it the biggest movie flop of all time.

It cost £158million to make the film about a 19th-century US Civil War soldier transported to Mars.

Disney also spent £63million promoting it. But ticket sales  shared with cinemas  only total £116million.

Studio chairman Rich Ross said: "It failed to connect with audiences."

Based on a book by Tarzan creator Edgar Rice Burroughs, the film stars Taylor Kitsch.
articles.teaser: COMPANY spent £158m to make science fiction film and another £63m promoting it
articles.headline: Disney epic John Carter expected to lose £126m
articles.subdeck: Disaster movie ... John Carter is set to lose a fortune for Disney

image.caption: Glitz and glamour ... Jedward and Tara Reid

article.caption: It's Pie time for a Reunion
First look at latest slice of American Pie

articles.articlebody:
JEDWARD had an American Reunion last night  as they hugged Celebrity Big Brother pal Tara Reid at the film's premiere.

The Irish twins joined the actress on the red carpet ahead of a screening of the fourth and final slice of the American Pie franchise.

Sporting their trademark towering barnets, John and Edward Grimes, 20, also donned silver jackets.

They were not the only ones in a party mood at the movie bash.

Actors Jason Biggs (Jim Levenstein) and John Cho playfully sandwiched fellow star Eddie Kaye Thomas (Finch) between them outside Grauman's Chinese Theatre in LA, California.

Alyson Hannigan (Michelle Flaherty-Levenstein) showed off her baby bump as she posed with Eugene Levy  notorious for his role as Jim's dad.

Alyson, 37, in expecting her second child with husband Alexis Denisof.

Meanwhile, Mena Suvari scored top marks in the glamour stakes as she turned heads with her black one-shouldered frock and classy hairdo.

Chris Klein, who plays Oz, posed with screen beauty Katrina Bowden  his boozy, party-loving girlfriend in the film.

Jason, 33, also paired up with Shannon Elizabeth (Nadia)  showing a lot more control in her company than he did in the original 1999 movie.

Seann William Scott, who plays Stifler, was also among those at the opening  looking dapper in a suit.

American Reunion features the hapless gang catching up 13 years after leaving high school at East Great Falls in Michigan.

The original film raised the bar for gross-out comedy, and the final flick promises to be equally shocking.

For example, one scene features Stifler defecating into a bin on the beach.

American Reunion is released in the UK on May 2.
articles.teaser: JOHN and Edward Grimes join actress at American Reunion premiere in LA
articles.headline: Jedward's American Reunion with Tara Reid
articles.subdeck: Glitz and glamour ... Jedward and Tara Reid

image.caption: Cold comfort ... Robert Pattinson faces Kristen Stewart in teaser

video.caption: TAYLOR Lautner and R-Patz star in short glimpse of the final Twilight movie

articles.articlebody:
TWIHARDS have been treated to a tiny bite of the long-awaited Breaking Dawn  Part 2.

A 14-second teaser for the final Twilight movie, released today, has a fleeting glimpse of Kristen Stewart's Bella, who turned vampire at the end of the last movie, running through the woods at her supersonic new speed

Taylor Lautner, as Jacob, faces her and looks surprised she still looks the same.

And, while we never see her face, Robert Pattinson takes her hand and tells her: "We're the same temperature now."

At the end of Breaking Dawn - Part 1 Bella gave birth to the couple's baby, before opening her eyes as a vampire in the final frame.

But the new teaser is keeping Bella's transformation hidden from the bloodthirsty Twilight fans.

More is likely to be revealed in a longer trailer ahead of showings of new flick The Hunger Games, which is released this weekend.

The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn  Part 2 is due for release on November 16 2012, and is set to be the most lucrative of the vampire series.

The previous five movies have a combined box office of £1.6billion.
articles.teaser: WATCH the first footage from vampire movie Breaking Dawn - Part 2 with 14-second teaser
articles.headline: A tiny bite of final Twilight movie

image.caption: Beach babe ... Alison in the late 1980s

article.caption: Adele wants to lose weight
Be a quitter and keep your figure
My 8-year takeaway binge cost £25k...and my unborn baby's life
You wouldn't eat 13 teaspoons of sugar in one go... so why drink it?

articles.articlebody:
THE average 45-year-old woman has been on 61 DIETS in her lifetime, according to a study.

That works out as more than two diets a year every year from the age of 16.

But fad eating habits with names as weird and wonderful as the Lunch Box Diet and the Dukan Diet have left many women with yoyo-ing moods as well as waistlines.

Self-confessed "chubster" Alison Noon admits she has tried everything in her bid to beat the bulge  but with no permanent results.

The researcher from Chiswick, west London, is the "average woman" from the poll  she is 45 and has tried 61 DIFFERENT diets.

Here, Alison explains why her weight-loss quest has left her miserable  and why she is still hooked on dieting.

ALISON NOON has tried every eating plan in the book.

Fluctuating between size 12 and 18 all her life has left her feeling perpetually depressed  and after 61 different diets she still cannot stop.

Alison admits she will try anything to shift some timber and reckons she has spent more than £5,000 on diets.

Since the start of this year she has already tried the Dukan Diet, the Cambridge Weight Plan, the Negative Calorie Diet  and the misery-inducing Cabbage Soup Diet.

Describing that particular fad, Alison says: "I had to weigh up whether the weight loss was worth the horrendous wind. I blamed the bad smells on the dog."

Constantly banning herself from the food she loves has made Alison's adult life a misery.

She says: "My hatred of being big has meant I have spent every day on a dieting roller coaster.

"I'm a fad diet junkie. It has become an addiction."

Alison's first diet memory goes back to when she was just 13.

She says: "I'll never forget the anxiety I felt when a shop girl told my mum there wasn't a school dress big enough for me.

"I squeezed into the size they had and trundled off to secondary school tugging at the hemline in embarrassment."

After being called "fatty" in that first year at school, Alison embarked on her first diet.

She says: "My mum had the Scarsdale Diet book and for six weeks I had grapefruit for breakfast, protein and salad for lunch and protein and veg for tea.

"Although I was always starving and grumpy, I stuck to it and lost a stone over the summer holidays and hit my goal weight of 8st.

"Even though I wasn't as skinny as some of my friends, I was just so happy to have been accepted."

But as soon as Alison stopped the diet plan, she shot back up to 9st, large for her 5ft 6in frame.

So she was actually HAPPY when she contracted glandular fever at the age of 16.

She says: "I lost a stone effortlessly  I was thrilled. I battled to stay that size but the weight I'd lost on the 'Glandular Fever Diet' didn't stay off.

"As soon as the biscuit barrel was in sight, I piled on the weight."

Alison's obsession got worse when she found even quicker fixes. Within six months of turning 19, she had tried the Fit For Life Diet, the Egg And Grapefruit Diet and the Banana Diet.

She adds: "I even tried the Lunch Box Diet. The idea is that you fill a lunch box up with lots of healthy food. That was great... until I started replacing the salad with chocolate."

During her twenties, Alison's weight fluctuated between a healthy 9½st and 10st  but she longed to be a stone lighter again.

A turning point in her dieting nightmare came when she married Frank, a photographer, now 48, in 1988 when she was 22.

She says: "I lost half a stone through a combination of nerves and WeightWatchers but, again, it didn't stay off. Within a year, I'd gone to almost 11st."

Alison got desperate and started the meal replacement Cambridge Weight Plan.

She says: "Within two months I was down to 8½st but, boy, it was hard. It was worth it though. I was slim and loving it."

Yo-yo dieting her way through the Eighties, Alison would spend hours researching gimmicks to keep herself below 10st  until she became pregnant for the first time in 1991.

She says: "I embraced eating for two and indulged in whatever I wanted, whenever I wanted. I looked massive.

"I was more than 14st when I gave birth to Charlie, who is now 20."

Afterwards, Alison got straight back into her fad diet cycle and spent a fortune on books and consultations to get back down to her beloved 9st.

But she explains: "Just as I hit the 10st mark, I found out I was pregnant with baby No2.

"Again, I ate for Britain. This time I was 13½st when I gave birth to Olivia in 1995."

Once more, Alison threw herself into a host of different diets.

She says: "You name it, I tried it. I'd feel motivated at the beginning and lose a few pounds but then I'd have a blip and pig out for a few days before embarking on another 'new' diet, telling myself this would be 'the one'."

Alison did not manage to slim down before becoming pregnant again in 2000.

The cycle of gorging and dieting continued after daughter Florence was born in 2001, and Alison flitted between 11 and 12½st.

Two years ago, Alison's husband told her he was worried because her stomach was bigger than her bust.

The Cambridge Weight Plan had worked for her in the past and, amazingly, she lost three-and-a-half stone in just three months.

She says: "At last I was 10st again. I stayed at that weight for six months by cutting out carbs.

"I looked great but missed bread and pasta."

But gradually the carbs slipped back on to her plate and Alison now admits: "I'm back to 12st... oh all right, 12½st."

"I hate being this big but I can't face another liquid replacement diet  unless the liquid is Sauvignon Blanc.

"Most of all, I'm sick of knowing that if I could just eat less and exercise more, my weight would naturally decrease. Perhaps then I would finally be happy."

image.caption: Hans on ... Reighner Deleighnie with secret 'lover'

article.caption: I've fallen in love with the Statue of Liberty
Amy's fairground attraction
I’m married to the Berlin Wall

articles.articlebody:
THIS is smitten Reighner Deleighnie with her secret "lover"  a statue of the Greek god of desire, Adonis.

The 40-year-old carer spends hours every day with the £395 moulding, made of cold marble that heats up with touch.

And she said: "I can honestly say I'm in love with him. He is my boyfriend and more."

But poor old Adonis cannot take fickle Reighner's devotion for granted.

She said: "I would never marry him, only because I couldn't be faithful."

And she told how one day she hoped to travel to Florence to meet her dream man, Michelangelo's statue of David.

Reighner, of South London, has an obsession known as objectum sexuality in which people feel romantic desire for inanimate objects.

The Sun told earlier this month how 27-year-old shop assistant Amanda Whittaker, of Leeds, had fallen for the Statue of Liberty.

Reighner has dubbed her loved one "Hans" because the Pointer Sisters' hit Slowhand was playing in her cab the day she brought him home.

She talks to him, keeps him close when she watches telly, kisses him, caresses him and reads to him.

She said: "Being in a relationship with Hans has changed my life.

"He never tires of the emotional side of it. I can talk to him for hours about what I'm feeling, something I could never do before in my relationships with a human man."

e.little@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By EMMA LITTLE , Health and Science Editor

articles.headline: I'm in love with 3ft statue of Adonis

article.caption: Fabrice Muamba was 'dead' for 78 minutes
Fabrice Muamba asks: Did we lose?
Muamba troll arrested
Prem star Fabrice is still critical
Pray for Fab
Muamba collapses on pitch

articles.articlebody:
IF FOOTBALLER Fabrice Muamba had not received life-saving CPR after his cardiac arrest during a match on Saturday, he might not be here today.

"Every week in the UK, 12 apparently fit young people under the age of 35 die from undiagnosed cardiac conditions," says Dr Steve Cox, director of screening at charity Cardiac Risk In The Young.

He added: "Eighty per cent of these deaths will occur with no prior symptoms."

But how many of us know the skills we would need to save someone if they collapsed in front of us?

Around 60 per cent of kids say they would be powerless to help if a passer-by needed resuscitating, even though CPR could DOUBLE a casualty's chance of survival.

That is why The Sun yesterday launched a campaign to get Emergency Life Skills, or ELS, added to the national curriculum.

The drive  in conjunction with the British Heart Foundation  has won backing from former footballer Vinnie Jones, who stars in new TV ads teaching people what to do.

Below is a simple guide showing how YOU could save someone's life.

It has been compiled by Maureen Talbot, senior cardiac nurse at the British Heart Foundation.

Sign our petition to have CPR taught in schools

She says: "If you're untrained in full CPR or unsure about giving the kiss of life, hands-only CPR can still help save a life.

"Just remember to call 999 then push hard and fast to the beat of Stayin' Alive by the Bee Gees.

Here, we speak to two people who know first-hand how heart problems can affect the young and fit.

Adam Donnelly



ADAM was just 17 when he suddenly died on a family holiday in Cyprus.

Since then his sister Sian, a PA, has been diagnosed with the heart problem that killed him. Sian, 20, who lives with her parents in Welwyn, Kent, says:

Adam was such a fit young man that even now it's hard to accept he died so suddenly.

We were enjoying a family holiday in Cyprus. Just minutes before he died, Adam had been laughing and playing water volleyball.

But then he said he felt unwell. He got out and sat on the side of the pool  before suddenly collapsing head first into the water.

My parents and I had gone for a walk and a friend of Adam's dashed to find us. By the time we got back, Adam had been pulled out of the pool.

An ambulance was on its way and a nurse was desperately giving him the kiss of life, trying to restart his heart.

Now we know Adam had had a cardiac arrest. Tragically, it was too late to save him.

Two post-mortems  one in Cyprus and one in the UK  confirmed he died of Sudden Adult Death Syndrome.

For years we believed it was something peculiar to Adam. Then two years ago Cry, The Sudden Death Charity, suggested the family should all be screened.

My mum Julie, 50, had heart checks first  and, astoundingly, was diagnosed with Brugada Syndrome.

Commonly associated with Sudden Adult Death Syndrome, it is an inherited condition that affects the heart's rhythm. A year later I too was diagnosed with it.

It was a shock to realise this syndrome was undoubtedly responsible for Adam's death in 2004 and the deaths of many other young people.

We then discovered it can be picked up by a simple ECG. Had Adam been tested his death could have been prevented.

In July 2010 I had a mini defibrillator fitted.

It is terrible to think Adam's death has probably saved my life.

That's why I believe everyone should undergo a routine heart trace at 14. If an irregular heartbeat is detected, doctors can investigate further.

Nick Dias



ASSISTANT site manager Nick collapsed in December and has now been fitted with a pacemaker.

The 27-year-old lives with fiancée Lynsey, 25, and their children, Brooke, five, and Riley, seven months, in Radlett, Herts. He says:

As a non-smoker, who is slim and exercises regularly, I never imagined I would have a heart problem.

But in December last year Lynsey and I were walking Brooke to school and after bending down to get her schoolbag from Riley's pushchair I passed out.

Seconds later I came round to find Lynsey looking very concerned. Apparently I'd fallen backwards and cracked my head on the pavement.

We assumed I'd fainted and carried on walking Brooke to school. But as we did so, Lynsey became more worried because I started talking gibberish  I kept repeating myself and asking strange questions.

After dropping Brooke off, Lynsey insisted on driving me to A&E at Watford General Hospital. She was worried I might have concussion.

The doctor said because I'd passed out, he wanted to check my heart. And I was horrified when the ECG detected a problem with the rhythm of my heart.

Terrifyingly, the doctor said I was suffering from heart block where the electrical impulses that make the heart beat don't always reach the heart.

I was lucky my heart had started beating again  but next time I might not be so lucky and if I wasn't treated, could have a full-blown cardiac arrest.

Doctors have been unable to find a reason for my heart block. As they have also found a slight problem with a heart valve, it is possibly something I was born with.

Since then I've had a pacemaker fitted.

Doctors say when the children are ten they will have to be tested too.

But it's something I feel should be routinely tested for in everyone. If it weren't for Lynsey insisting I go to A&E that day, I might not have discovered this.

And ultimately I could have suddenly suffered a potentially fatal cardiac arrest at any time.
articles.teaser: AS Bolton's Fabrice Muamba recovers from heart attack, we show you how to save a life
articles.headline: What would YOU do?
